title: enemies
comment: Opponents or hostile forces which pose a threat to people or nations. Scripture identifies Satan as being the particular enemy of God and notes many enemies of the people of God. Scripture urges caution and courage in dealing with such enemies. Jesus Christ had enemies, and he provides an example of Christian conduct in the face of enemies' threats.

children.title: enemies, of Israel and Judah
children.comment: Throughout their history, Israel and Judah contended with enemies committed to their destruction, finding refuge only in their covenant-keeping God.

children.title: The Canaanites and the surrounding nations
Those opposed to the rebuilding under Ezra and Nehemiah
They were often more numerous than Israel
They were determined to destroy Israel
They were often in league with each other
God helped Israel against her enemies
Israel was not to fear them
Israel was to pray for deliverance
Kindness was to be shown to Israel's enemies
Thanksgiving for victory over Israel's enemies
Giving thanks to God was the proper response to victory
Israel often forgot to give thanks to God
God used enemies to chastise Israel

seealsos.comment: Because of his covenant, the LORD was unwilling to destroy Israel completely at the hand of her enemies

children.title: enemies, of Jesus Christ
children.comment: Throughout his life Jesus Christ was opposed by both spiritual and human enemies. He overcame every enemy so that his people might be set free by his victory.

children.title: The enemies of the infant Jesus
Satan as the enemy of Jesus Christ
In the temptation in the wilderness
The Jewish leaders as enemies of Jesus Christ
They plotted to kill Jesus Christ
They had no real reason for hating him
Judas as the enemy of Jesus Christ
The enemies of Jesus Christ succeeded in killing him in accordance with God's will
Jesus Christ did not retaliate but prayed for his enemies
Jesus Christ can change an enemy into a friend
Jesus Christ will ultimately conquer all his enemies
enemies, of believers
children.comment: Christians must expect to face many enemies on account of their faith. Jesus Christ made it clear that such opposition was the inevitable result of commitment to him. Nevertheless, Christians are called upon to love their enemies.

children.title: Christians are enemies of the world because they belong to Jesus Christ
Opposition to Christians is opposition to Jesus Christ
Christians may be killed by their enemies
To love, do good, bless and pray for them
To help and show kindness to them
To show kindness to their beasts of burden
Not to rejoice in their misfortunes
The need to engage in spiritual warfare
God supports his people against their enemies
Death as the last enemy to be destroyed by Jesus Christ
enemy, Satan as the enemy of God
